posts.post_content:
[Sigarda, Host of Herons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigarda, Host of Herons), [Avacyn, Angel of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Angel of Hope), [Empyrial Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Archangel) (or alternatively [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel)), [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria), [Linvala, Keeper of Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Linvala, Keeper of Silence), [Angel of Jubilation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Jubilation), [Gaddock Teeg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaddock Teeg), 2\*[Privileged Position](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Privileged Position), [Rule of Law](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rule of Law),  [Gavony Township](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Gavony Township), [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls), [Alchemist's Refuge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alchemist's Refuge) (or alternatively [Vedalken Orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Orrery)), [Ghostway](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostway), [Archangel's Light](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archangel's Light) (or alternatively [Elixir of Immortality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elixir of Immortality)).  
  
Disregarding the feasibility of realizing the entire combo and the overall efficiency when piloting, creating a deck with all these cards combined results in a deck **that can't lose**.
posts.html:
Sigarda, Host of Herons, Avacyn, Angel of Hope, Empyrial Archangel (or alternatively Platinum Angel), Iona, Shield of Emeria, Linvala, Keeper of Silence, Angel of Jubilation, Gaddock Teeg, 2*Privileged Position, Rule of Law, Gavony Township, Cavern of Souls, Alchemist's Refuge (or alternatively Vedalken Orrery), Ghostway, Archangel's Light (or alternatively Elixir of Immortality).

Disregarding the feasibility of realizing the entire combo and the overall efficiency when piloting, creating a deck with all these cards combined results in a deck that can't lose.

Posted By: StoicChampion (4/29/2012 12:50:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.

posts.post_content:
If anyone ever gets out Blossom, Bubbles, Buttercup, and Sorin-in-Drag out at the same time....o.O  
  
Yeah, that is probably a game you are going to win.  
  
Oh and Maelstrom Archangel and Kaalia of the Vast in the same deck make your idea completely feasible StoicChampion. Your general should probably be Scion of the Ur-Dragon, running all 5 Invasion Dragons, all 5 Kamigawa Dragons, and all 5 Planar Chaos Dragons, plus the Powerpuff Girls Angels.  
  
In fact, Maelstrom Archangel should be the only non-Legendary creature in your deck. :)  
  
EDIT: don't care if banned or not. must have Kokusho for the sake of Mega Cycle completeness! when you take him out they are just going to notice you are also running the Power Puffs with Kaalia and then they will still stop playing with you- might as well pull as much B.S. in Game 1 as possible before getting banned for life from your playgroup ;D

posts.post_content:
ADDED: how the freak did pointing out an enchcantment that gives +2/+2 , trample and lifelink make the top rated comment overall?
  
   
That is just.. URG. the rating system should not be open to people with bad judgment.
  
   
---
  
   
Let's list the ways to get rid of her...
  
   
1) Block her or force her to block something with power 5+ (or deathtouch)
  
2) Day of Judgment (standard) Wrath of God (modern), basically feild clear.
  
3) Legends rule. So, Phantasmal image and phyrexian metamorph, or someone playing with her themselves.
  
   
5 mana for a 5/5 flying is insane as is. This card has one of the easiest times ever. Liliana Viel will cry at it, geths verdict and tribute to hunger no longer matter.
  
   
I ascociate this card on the same level as Thrun, the Last Troll. Putting her down guarantee’s significant field dominance for a good portion of the game. 5 mana is not hard to get, and in the colors of low mana winee spam? She is going to be a standard staple, decks built in WG just to use... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Wisdomseyes (5/4/2012 11:43:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@wooplin  
  
"HA! You can't stop my Shape Anew!!!!  
  
"Ruling: 1/1/2011  
'If the targeted artifact's controller can't sacrifice it (due to Tajuru Preserver, perhaps), the other effects of the spell will still happen.'"  
  
Unless the situation you're describing is one of your opponent is playing [Shape Anew](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shape Anew) on one of your creatures, I don't see how this is relevant. For Sigarda's ability to do anything, the spell has to be controlled by one of your opponents and also has to be making you sacrifice a creature. So I guess in the corner case where you have Sigarda and [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) out and your opponent tries to Shape Anew it, yes, the Colossus stays in play and you get your polymorph effect.
posts.html:
@wooplin

"HA! You can't stop my Shape Anew!!!!

"Ruling: 1/1/2011
'If the targeted artifact's controller can't sacrifice it (due to Tajuru Preserver, perhaps), the other effects of the spell will still happen.'"

Unless the situation you're describing is one of your opponent is playing Shape Anew on one of your creatures, I don't see how this is relevant. For Sigarda's ability to do anything, the spell has to be controlled by one of your opponents and also has to be making you sacrifice a creature. So I guess in the corner case where you have Sigarda and Blightsteel Colossus out and your opponent tries to Shape Anew it, yes, the Colossus stays in play and you get your polymorph effect.

posts.post_content:
Too powerful, I don't like it. Her abilities narrow the range of stuff that can kill her so much that she'll be format warping on her own. It'll certainly keep [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) and [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image)'s prices pretty high and it will probably bring [Day of Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgement) back into style quick smart.  
  
At least with Thrun (also not a fun card) you could fly over him or outsize him with a defender. Sigardia is going to remain relevant for the whole game, either hitting you or blocking.
posts.html:
